item.title: Ken Robinson: Do schools kill creativity?
item.description:
Ken Robinson: Do schools kill creativity?

Sir Ken Robinson makes an entertaining and profoundly moving case for creating an education system that nurtures (rather than undermines) creativity.

item.title: Pinboard.in Architecture - Pay to Play to Keep a System Small - High Scalability -
item.description:
Pinboard.in Architecture - Pay to Play to Keep a System Small - High Scalability -

Wednesday, December 29, 2010 at 8:42AM How do you keep a system small enough, while still being successful, that a simple scale-up strategy becomes the preferred architecture? StackOverflow, for example, could stick with a tool chain they were comfortable with because they had a natural brake on how fast they could grow: there are only so many programmers in the world.
